item.title: A Note on Distributed Systems
item.description: A Note on Distributed Systems: A Summary This post distills the material presented in the paper titled “A Note on Distributed Systems” published in 1994 by Jim Waldo et al. The paper presents the differences between local & distributed computing in the context of Object Oriented Programming, explaining why treating them to the be same is incorrect and leads to applications that aren’t robust or reliable. Introduction: The paper kicks off by stating that the current work in distributed systems is modeled around objects, more specifically, a unified view of objects: objects are defined by their supported interfaces & the operations they support.
